Course_Name: [SoSe 2024] Research Seminar: Operations Management using Python and Gurobi

Discussions.Discussion_Name: Reminder guest lecture Dr.-Ing Jochen Kemper (Head of Production Master Production Scheduling Volkswagen Cars) 4th of July

Messages.Author: Grace Tia Kathleen Wojatzki
Messages.Content: Dear Students, we would like to remind you of the upcoming guest lecture held by Dr.-Ing Jochen Kemper this Thursday in H3007 from 10am to 12pm.  Join us for an unique opportunity to gain insides to the production in the automotive industry at a large car manufacturer. If you plan to attend kindly register via this link. We hope to see a lot of you there. Best Regards,  Team POM

Discussions.Discussion_Name: Guest lecture by Dr.-Ing Jochen Kemper (Head of Production Master Production Scheduling Volkswagen Cars)

Messages.Author: Grace Tia Kathleen Wojatzki
Messages.Content: Dear Students, We are very delighted to announce an upcoming guest lecture by Dr.-Ing Jochen Kemper, head of production master production scheduling at Volkswagen, scheduled for june 24 at 10:15 am in room H 3007. Mr Kemper will give us an insight into his experiences with production scheduling at one of the world's leading car manufacturers, Volkswagen. As the current head of production master production scheduling, Dr. Kemper has been instrumental in shaping the efficiency and effectiveness of Volkswagen's production processes. His leadership in the innovative "Digitaler Blick" project earned his team a special prize at the German Award for Supply Chain Management in 2020, highlighting his profound understanding of contemporary industry challenges. After graduating at the Technical University Braunschweig (industrial engineering) and Technical University Dortmund (mechanical engineering), he was a lecturer at the Ostfalia University of Applied Sciences for supply-chain-management and logistics management. Mr Kemper has been working at Volkswagen since 2016, initially as Head of Strategy, Communication and the Logistics Campus, making him one of the youngest heads ever at Volkswagen. His commitment to advancing the field extends beyond his professional role, as he actively contributes to the research council of the BVL, an almost 10.000 members strong network promoting ideas in supply chain management and logistics. Attendance for this unique opportunity is highly recommended and we are looking forward to seeing you all there! If you would like to join us please register here. All the best, your POM-Team

Messages.Author: Grace Tia Kathleen Wojatzki
Messages.Content: Dear Students,  a small correction. The guest lecture will take place on the 4th of July. We apologize for any inconvenience.  Best regards, your POM-Team

Messages.Author: Nico Gärtner
Messages.Content: Dear POMcoding#lab group, the evaluation for the quiz on assembly line balancing has been completed. Best regards, Nico

Discussions.Discussion_Name: Guest lecture by Luc van Nerom/PSI Metals

Messages.Author: Nico Gärtner
Messages.Content: Dear Students, as part of the PSiP module, an English-language guest lecture by Luc van Nerom will take place on Monday, June 24th, from 2:15 PM to 3:45 PM in H 0112, to which we would like to invite you. Luc van Nerom, Managing Director at PSI Metals, is a pioneer in production planning and has significantly influenced the metal industry with Line Scheduling. He currently leads Product Innovation Management at PSI Metals and brings decades of experience in the development and implementation of artificial intelligence. As early as 1986, he founded the company "Artificial Intelligence Systems" to integrate AI and optimization technologies into the metal industry. After the merger with PSI Metals, his work became a central component of their production planning software. With nearly 38 years at the company, van Nerom's dedication and innovative spirit have been crucial to the company's success. Today, PSI Metals is the world’s largest provider of software solutions for production management in the metal industry. Best regards, Your POM Team

Messages.Author: Nico Gärtner
Messages.Content: Dear POMcoding#lab group, here's a brief update on the further course of the seminar: After the second quiz on ALB ends on sunday at 11:59 pm, the second phase of the seminar will begin. On Monday, June 17, the group/topic selection will be unlocked here on ISIS until Wednesday, June 19 at 11:59 pm. In groups of three or four, choose one of the two quiz topics (MPP or ALB). Based on this decision, you will compose your paper. Also on Monday, June 17, there will be an online session by Professor Volling on the introduction to scientific work. One week later on June 24, we will meet again in room H6126 to discuss your idea for model expansion, the potential title of your paper, and your initial reference papers. I highly recommend to prepare yourselves and your project idea as well as possible (slides or similar) so that you can receive constructive feedback. You can also find all the information in the schedule and the first slides for introduction. Until then, best of luck with the quiz, and greetings, Nico

Messages.Author: Nico Gärtner
Messages.Content: Dear POMcoding group, the evaluation for the quiz on Master Production Planning has been completed. All the best, Nico

Messages.Author: Henri Decker
Messages.Content: Dear students, If you registered for the field trip to Tesla, you should have received an invitation email from Tesla today. Please sign up using the link in the email and bring the generated QR code with you to Tesla. If you did not receive an email, please contact us immediately. Best regards Henri

Messages.Author: Nico Gärtner
Messages.Content: Dear students, unfortunately, there was a small error in the schedule. Contrary to the initial announcement, there will be no video recording today. Instead, the lecture will be held in person. We apologize for the short notice and any inconvenience this may cause. We look forward to welcoming you to the in-person lecture today (May 13) at 4 pm. Best regards, Nico

Discussions.Discussion_Name: Field trip to Tesla's Gigafactory - Parking Spots

Messages.Author: Juri Zahn
Messages.Content: Dear students, in response to several requests, we are providing some information regarding the parking situation for our upcoming field trip to Tesla's Gigafactory on May 23rd between 2:30 and 4:30 pm. There are two options you may want to consider. Firstly, you can park your car at the S-Bahn Station Erkner. Next to the station is a limited number of parking spaces available. These spaces are free of charge, however, please note that they are frequently used by commuters traveling to Berlin, so availability is not guaranteed. If you manage to find a parking spot, you can then catch the TES-Shuttle at 2:05 pm or any earlier shuttle. Alternatively, your second option is to drive directly to the Gigafactory. There are approximately 100 parking spots reserved for visitors, located in front of the Visitor Centre. As far as I am aware, these spots are currently free of charge. Until then we wish you a great time. Best regards your POM Team

Messages.Author: Nico Gärtner
Messages.Content: Dear students, we are looking forward to offering you a field trip to the Tesla Gigafactory on May 23rd between 2:30 and 4:30 pm. The excursion will take place together with the AutoPOM course. To ensure that everyone has an equal chance to register, registration for the limited number of places will start tomorrow at 2pm via the link provided here in the ISIS course. If you successfully register for the excursion, we ask you to hand over a deposit of 5 euros to me next Monday(05/06) after the session. Please bring exactly 5 euros, as we will not be able to give change. The money will of course be returned to you when you arrive for the excursion. IMPORTANT! By signing up for the excursion, you consent to register as a guest in the Tesla portal with your full name, e-mail, and photo. Recommended arrival: Depart from Zoologischer Garten at 1:08 pm on the RE 1, arriving in Erkner at 1:46 pm. Then, catch the TES-Shuttle at 2:05 pm, which will get you to the factory by 2:16 pm. From the arrival point, proceed to the lobby, which should take approximately 10 minutes at a releaxed pace. We look forward to seeing you there and wish you a successful week! All the best, Nico

Messages.Author: Nico Gärtner
Messages.Content: Dear students, please remember that course registration starts tonight at 8pm on Moses. Deadline for registration is April 22nd also at 8pm. If registrations exceed capacity, the "first come, first served" principle applies together with the prioritization rules of the university (mandatory, elective, free choice, erasmus, etc.). There will also be a waiting list. Thank you for your understanding and we wish you all a great start to the new semester. All the best, Nico

Messages.Author: Paul Heiner Darius
Messages.Content: Hello fellow students,  I signed up for group Master-ALB-5. ALB-1 to 3 are full, but it looks like there are no more active students in the course that could join me. So I seem to be alone - I know that sounds pathetic :) Is there somebody from group 1 to 3 who can imagine joining me?  I would much more prefer to work in a group than alone!   Have a great start into the weekend, Paul

Messages.Author: Ron Tschiggfrei
Messages.Content: Hello, I have a question regarding the last 2 tasks in the ALB Homework: It says: "which possible extensions should we implement in the model to make it more applicable in our real life setting? Please give us a suggestion and explanation why we should implement your suggestion. If it is possible, would you also be so kind to give us a code snipplet which helps us illustrate the results of the last run?" This is formulated a bit vague and most of us are not 100% sure what is meant with a "real life setting". Is it the consideration of different variants that are produced on our assembly line in the model? Or are there other things to consider? Thank you very much

Messages.Author: Marcel Endres
Messages.Content: Hello, during the adaptions in the provided notebook for the questions from the quiz I noticed that the symmetry break does not work as expected, as sometimes a lower station number is not preferred in the optimal solution. When I change the penalty in the symbreak constraint from 0.1 to 0.2 I get the expected behaviour and even a lower objective value.  How should I go one from there? Best, Marcel

Messages.Author: Nico Gärtner
Messages.Content: Hi Marcel,  as we want to minimize the cycle time, the number of stations should only change if manual adjustments are made.  Apart from that, your OV should actually always be as low as possible. Are you sure that your gap is always 0? If not, try the following: m.setParam("MIPgap", 0)  Best regards, Nico

Messages.Author: Marcel Endres
Messages.Content: Hi Nico, thank you! Setting the gap to 0 yielded the same behaviour and now I have the expected assignment. With the lower station number I meant that e.g. task 1 is assigned to station 2 and task 2 to station 1, where I assumed to have t1->s1 and t2->s2 with the symmetry break (hypothetical problem and not from my results :D). The actual number of stations stayed the same. Best Marcel

Discussions.Discussion_Name: precedence relation in home work assignment 2

Messages.Author: Paul Heiner Darius
Messages.Content: hi everybody,  i have a question concerning the homework assignment 2.  There is no precendence order written in the text to having the lights installed before the bike is packed, adressed and franked. in my view this is necessary, but the text says only "When all THESE steps were carried out the scooter is ready to be packaged", which refers to the specific contraints given in the text.  Since it changes the allocation order, i wanted to kindly ask for clearification.  also, do i assume right that the changes made for task i are also valid for task i+1, ... etc?   thank you in advance, paul

Messages.Author: Nico Gärtner
Messages.Content: Hi Paul,  read the e-mail again more closely, there is a clear precedence relation given.  Unless otherwise stated, changes remain valid.  Best regards, Nico

Messages.Author: Rafael Dobler
Messages.Content: Hi guys, we've opened a telegram group for the course. Feel free to join :) https://t.me/+Ag26HnENLXcyM2My

Messages.Author: Paul Heiner Darius
Messages.Content: Hello,  I have a question regarding the programming task. In the 3rd constraint defining the LTA balance, we are asked to subtract the regular production capacity c_0. What is the regular production capacity?  We have capacities for each level. Is it just the average of all capacity levels? maybe i am just confused rn. i would be grateful for clearification -  Thank you in advance!

Messages.Author: Nico Gärtner
Messages.Content: Hello Paul,  the first capacity level is meant by the regular production capacity.  Best regards, Nico

Discussions.Discussion_Name: [Field trip]Anyone else leaving from TU to Tesla's Gigafactory

Messages.Author: Jiaao Li
Messages.Content: Hi, if you are going from TU to Tesla, we can go together. Let me know if you are interested. I would just use the arrival plan recommended by Nico. Recommended arrival: Depart from Zoologischer Garten at 1:08 pm on the RE 1, arriving in Erkner at 1:46 pm. Then, catch the TES-Shuttle at 2:05 pm, which will get you to the factory by 2:16 pm. From the arrival point, proceed to the lobby, which should take approximately 10 minutes at a releaxed pace.

Discussions.Discussion_Name: Prerequisites/Recommended knowledge for visiting this course

Messages.Author: Arthur Kraft
Messages.Content: Hello teaching team, I just have a short question about the prerequisites and recommended knowledge for this course. I don't have any knowledge from basic production and operations management as it is recommended at Moses, but strong programming skills. I study M. Sc. Information Systems Management and would be interested to take this course in this or the next semester. That is why I would ask for a recommendation from your side - do you think it is manageable to follow this course and fill knowledge gaps on my own during the semester? Is this course self-contained or does it explicitly depend on other courses with lots of referrals to content that was already discussed in other lectures? Thank you very much! Best regards, Arthur

Messages.Author: Nico Gärtner
Messages.Content: Dear Arthur,  of course, we also discuss topics in the seminar that are covered in other modules. Nevertheless, the course is self-contained and can be successfully completed without any prior knowledge.  All the best, Nico

Messages.Author: Arthur Kraft
Messages.Content: Dear Nico,  all right, thanks for the quick answer!  Best wishes, Arthur

Discussions.Discussion_Name: About online availability of the course

Messages.Author: Raiyan Mahmud Tanim
Messages.Content: Dear Professor, I am a first-semester student of the program Msc Information Systems Management. Can this course be taken online? Due to the visa issues, I won't be able to attend in-person lectures until June. So if lectures can be taken online up until June, I will continue the course. Or else I'll need to unenroll. Can you confirm if the course can be attended remotely? Thank you.

Messages.Author: Nico Gärtner
Messages.Content: Dear Raiyan,  there is no compulsory attendance until June 24.  The notebooks and solutions uploaded by us should contain everything you need for the self-study.  However, it is important that you do not miss the deadlines for registration, quizzes and group finding.  Best regards, Nico

Messages.Author: Raiyan Mahmud Tanim
Messages.Content: Thank you sir for the clarification. I have one more doubt. Since I'll be following the lectures online and if for some reason I can't really cope up with the course since I won't be able to do the lectures in person at least until June, in that case, will I be able to unenroll/de-register from the course? I mean if I find it hard to self study, can I deregister in the middle? Thank you sir.

Messages.Author: Nico Gärtner
Messages.Content: Dear Raiyan,  should there indeed be more registrations than our capacities allow, it would be very unfortunate if the slot were to be blocked.  Deregistration is only possible until the first graded part (Quiz 1).  Best regards, Nico
